input.description: adapter name [Optional] The name of the adapter that is enabled on the Peer. The default adapter name is HPSEActor

1. Lists all discovery schedules Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>list</command> <category>configuration</category> <process-id>find-schedule-details</process-id> <command-arguments> <discovery/> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. discovery[Required] Indicates that discovery schedule details are required
2. Lists the specified discovery schedule Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>list</command> <category>configuration</category> <process-id>find-schedule-details</process-id> <command-arguments> <discovery-id>1163</discovery-id> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. discovery-id[Required] id of the discovery schedule whose details are required
3. Lists performance data aging schedules Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>list</command> <category>configuration</category> <process-id>find-schedule-details</process-id> <command-arguments> <performance> <dataaging/> </performance> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. performance[Required] Indicates that performance schedule type details are required dataaging[Required] Indicates that dataging schedule details are required
4. Lists the specified performance data aging schedule Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <command>list</command> <category>configuration</category> <process-id>find-schedule-details</process-id> <command-arguments> <performance> <dataaging-id>1008</dataaging-id> </performance> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. performance[Required] Indicates that performance schedule type details are required dataaging-id[Required] id of the dataging schedule whose details are required
5. Lists All performance datacollection schedules Sample Request XML:

Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. performance[Required] Indicates that performance schedule type details are required datacollection[Required] Indicates that datacollection schedule details are required

Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. performance[Required] Indicates that performance schedule type details are required datacollection-id[Required] id of the datacollection schedule whose details are required

Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. producthealth[Required] Indicates that producthealth schedule type details are required diskspace[Required] Indicates that diskspace schedule details are required

documentation.description:
This wrapper supports the following requirements:-
1. Lists all discovery schedules. 2. Lists the specified discovery schedule. 3. Lists performance data aging schedules. 4. Lists the specified performance data aging schedule. 5. Lists performance data collection for all schedules. 6. Lists the specified data collection schedules. 7. Lists all product health disk space schedules. 8. Lists the product health log file schedule. 9. Lists the product health rmanbackup schedule. 10. Lists report cache schedule basic details. 11. Lists report cleanup schedule basic details. 12. Lists report data aging schedules basic details. 13. Lists the specified report data aging schedule. 14. Lists all report data collection schedules basic details. 15. Lists the specified report data collection schedules basic details. 16. Lists the specified scheduled deliveries basic details. 17. Shows details of all discovery schedules. This command works in the same way as the Discovery tab on the Configuration tab on the main page of the management server’s user interface. 18. Shows details of the specified discovery schedule. 19. Shows details of all performance data aging schedules. The same information is provided as resides on the Data Collection tab in the user interface. 20. Shows details of the specified performance data aging schedule. 21. Shows details of performance datacollection for all schedules. This command works in the same way as the Data Collection tab on the Performance tab in the management server’s user interface. 22. Shows details of the specified data collection schedule. 23. Shows details of product health disk space schedules. 24. Shows details of the product health log file schedule. 25. Shows details of the product health rmanbackup schedule. 26. Shows details of the report cache schedule. 27. Shows details of the report cleanup schedule. 28. Shows details of report data aging schedules. 29. Shows details of the specified report data aging schedule. 30. Shows details of report data collection schedules. 31. Shows details of the specified report data collection schedules. 32. Shows details of global reporter schedule.
